<task>

<question>
What will be the <LU LEMMA="change" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">change</LU> of the <LU LEMMA="interference" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">interference</LU> <LU LEMMA="pattern" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">pattern</LU> of <LU LEMMA="Newton" CAT="N" DRV="POSESSIVE" FLX="TABLE" TYPE="Prop" Nb="s">Newton</LU>'s <LU LEMMA="ring" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="p">rings</LU> if the <LU LEMMA="slot" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">slot</LU> between the <LU LEMMA="lens" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">lens</LU> and the <LU LEMMA="plane" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">plane</LU> is filled by <LU LEMMA="liquid" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">liquid</LU> having <LU LEMMA="minor" CAT="A">minor</LU> <LU LEMMA="refractive" CAT="A">refractive</LU> index in respect to the <LU LEMMA="glass" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">glass</LU> <LU LEMMA="refractive" CAT="A">refractive</LU> index?
</question>
<answers>
<answer right="no">	The <LU LEMMA="interference" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">interference</LU> <LU LEMMA="pattern" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">pattern</LU> remains.</answer>
<answer right="no">	The <LU LEMMA="interference" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">interference</LU> <LU LEMMA="pattern" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">pattern</LU> will become inverse.</answer>
<answer right="no">	Radiuses of the <LU LEMMA="ring" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="p">rings</LU> will <LU LEMMA="increase" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">increase</LU>.</answer>
<answer right="yes">Radiuses of the <LU LEMMA="ring" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="p">rings</LU> will <LU LEMMA="decrease" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">decrease</LU>.</answer>
<answer right="no">	The will be no <LU LEMMA="interference" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">interference</LU> <LU LEMMA="pattern" CAT="N" FLX="TABLE" Nb="s">pattern</LU>.</answer>
<answer right="no">	No right answer.</answer>
</answers>
